website_summaries.verdict: While not without some weaknesses, the Creative Sound Blaster Jam is a strong budget Bluetooth headphone that delivers good sound for its modest price point.
pros: The Creative Sound Blaster is an inexpensive, lightweight, on-ear Bluetooth headphone that fits comfortably and sounds good for its price
It also offers decent battery life (12 hours)
cons: Doesn't work so well as a headset for making calls
design may be a little too basic for some people

customer_reviews.title: Can't hear my obnoxious coworker
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great! One charge gets me at least 2 days of use. I ordered this pair exclusively for work so that I could drown out my loud talking, never ending conversation, energizer bunny-like, irritating coworker. And these headphones have finally allowed me to get work done without hearing her mind-numbing conversations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super simple. They feel great
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved headphones, delivered on Sunday!! Anyway they took less than 20 seconds to pair to my Iphone 7 and my Imac! Super simple. They feel great, lightweight and fairly well constructed, although I probably wouldn't toss them across the room, but they are solid. Sound is very crisp but they could be a little louder. Some songs from my phone seem to have a higher volume than others but the quality is just as promised. Overall a very good deal.!!! I would certainly recommend them. Good value and so far good product. Does exactly what is says. And as usual fast free Prime shipping!!
customer_reviews.author: James S. Diblasi Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Just average headphones...
customer_reviews.text: These simply not as life-changing as the 4.5 star indicator and Amazon endorsement would lead you to believe. They're "ok". Good parts are: they're lightweight, barely feels like you're wearing them, good sound quality for music and phone calls, extra bass is nice, good sounding mike for phone calls. Bad parts are: don't bend over or they fall off (no sticky headband material), headband is plastic and looks like it will easily break, ear "cups" are low quality plastic foam, no song fwd/bkwd button, frequent Bluetooth drop-outs when playing music when the phone is a mere 2 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Jeeves

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great. Really good sound for the price point and the ONLY headphones I have EVER purchased for my teens that have lasted. I have spent four times the money on other headphones that have offered great replacement warranties(at buyers expense!)but the best is when the warranty doesn’t have to be used! The first pair I purchased are still going strong (year and a half later)and my oldest wears them every day. These headphones have stopped my kids from daydreaming about other $200 headphones, all it took was great sound that worked every time they used it at a reasonable price. Thank you Creative for filling a tall order!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Buy
customer_reviews.text: Like: Lightweight, comfortable, sturdy enough, Bluetooth 4.1 with fast connection, long battery life, affordable, decent sound quality. Dislike: Fashion backwards, foam ear-pads can start to feel warm after awhile. Bottom Line: One of the best budget Bluetooth headsets out there.
customer_reviews.author: Primer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Budget Bluetooth Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The best Bluetooth headphones I've ever purchased. A definite bargain. Extremely comfortable to wear (listening while watching a lengthy movie caused little if any discomfort). They sound great! Adequate bass, mids and highs. Easy pairing (have not yet tried them with a smart-phone). The controls are fairly simple to access on the right ear-pad. Also, you don't have to worry about proper right/left orientation -- these headphones are shaped to fit in only one optimum position.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Arnone

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: After considering more expensive BT headphones I decided to go the less expensive route. What a great choice! The Sound Blaster Jam headphones sound great for the money, are very comfortable and the battery life is longer than I care to accurately measure. Would I prefer $350 noise canceling BT headphones? Sure! Who wouldn't? At 10% of the cost I'll settle for a little less and still get great value. The Sound Blaster Jams are easy to pair with iOS and Windows 10 (haven't used with other OSs) and phone calls are crystal clear on both ends. At least no one has complained when during phone conversations. Bottom line, I enjoy these headphones and have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Christy & Tyler Barwick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for TV/Video/Music/Phone Calls Super Light!
customer_reviews.text: Good enough sound for TV/Video/Music thru iPads or cell phones and perfect for phone calls! That's actually what I got it for, hands free wireless calls and watching stuff on my iPad or phone. No issues with pairing, hearing them/them hearing me, or battery life. Granted these aren't audiophile status but they didn't cost much either. Super super light though seriously dated with foam ear muffs. Works exactly as expected and intended! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: BluePnut

customer_reviews.title: Great work headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I listen to music all day at work. The thing is, I get warm quickly and I also need to hear what's going on around me. I love these headphones because the foam earpieces stay cool and they are lightweight. I never get sweaty or feel pressure on my head from how they fit. The sound is good quality. These aren't the headphones you take on an airplane to drown out noise, but they are perfect for the office. The sound great and look kind of cheap so nobody will want to steal them.
customer_reviews.author: RS in TX

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones durable battery lasts all day at work (8hr work day) and they don't hurt on your ears the only annoying thing is they take a long time to turn on/off and that if your music is too loud you will be able to hear it outside of the headphones also.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Favorite budget Gym Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am the perpetual bargain shopper for almost everything. With headphones, I'm extra bad. I have owned at least a half a dozen different types of bluetooth headphones in search of the best budget headphones for the gym. So far, these are an easy 1st place. They are the most comfortable Ive ever used and the sound is "good enough". Let's face it, i'm working out, not sitting in a leather chair analyzing the decibels. I love these and recommend them to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: MR. E

customer_reviews.title: An old name in a new game
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are a complete audiophile these headphones are perfect. Light, comfortable, cheap, decent sounding, easy to use and name brand for whatever that's worth. They're OK to look at though not stylish with good battery life and charge-while-using capability. The only negative thing I will say is that they are yet another Bluetooth device that won't pair with my Samsung Chromebook. I have determined through trial error with many devices that the Chromebook is not fully Bluetooth compliant so I can not rate these headphone lower since I don't believe this is Creative's fault. If you do need Chromebook support I have found that Amazon Basic's devices seem compatible.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Rendek

customer_reviews.title: Everyday headphones, good balance of sound and comfortability
customer_reviews.text: Between earbuds and over the earphones these are perfect balance. Often you wear earbuds but hated how they don't seal or fit properly. Over the ear ones tends to be too hot to wear in the summer or too much sound isolation which can be bad when you need to hear some sounds. These are very easy to pair without the long delays of some others. The sound is good quality for general purpose. It isn't an audiophile, the sound is tuned for all kinds even for talk radio listening or video watching without having to adjust the fade.
customer_reviews.author: KevT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and product.
customer_reviews.text: Going to give this a 5 star rating and doing so for the following reasons: 1. Thing thing is super light, but, didn't feel cheap. Very comfortable and the fact it is sort of turned in, sits perfectly on the ears without having to constantly adjust. 2. The price, the quality and sound for the price is simply awesome. 3. Very easy to pair with my phone and worked and range is awesome. Would definitely recommend if you're in the market for a cheaper BT headphone that you'd use at places like the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 Years and Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 years and still going strong. Good sound quality. Fits my small head well. Just loose enough to avoid a headache, but not quite tight enough to tilt forward without slipping. So, not great while doing chores, but great for relaxing with Netflix. Very happy with price, quality, longevity and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Vela

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE HEADPHONES!
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones! I have 4 pair each connected to a bluetooth transmitter connected to the TV. Wife an I watch our shows/movies with these every day as we can have them as loud as we want without waking the baby. Sound quality is great and bass good too for an open headphone. Very comfortable to wear for long TV watching or gaming sessions. I do also like being able to hear what my wife says while we watch TV together and talk about the episode. Couldn't really do that with closed headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying my Sound Blaster!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for myself as a Christmas gift. Thus far I am impressed. I've purchased Creative products previously. I still have a 30 gb mp3 player in my possession. I do find myself from time to time adjusting the band for comfort. The fact that there is no padding at the top of the headphones don't bother me. Sound, clarity is on point. Bluetooth pairing is easy. I use my headphones for movie watching, music and Stitcher podcasts. Thought I'd give wireless headphones but didn't want to invest a whole lot of money in my first pair. Overall, a good headset.
customer_reviews.author: BookEnds

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great. I wear them all day at work for 10 hours. They fit well. They are designed so the ear covers are on an angle, which is unique and works well for relieving pressure on the ear. Granted the sound quality is not that of a Bose headset, but for the price it's very good. First day on the test so not sure of battery life, but will update. They are very lightweight. Don't let the looks fool you as they don't look as though they are a quality item, but if it wouldn't be for the light pressure squeezing them on my head I would not know I am wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: A normal-sized pair of headphones for normal-sized heads
customer_reviews.text: I loved the sound quality of my MDR-XB950BT headphones, but the darn things were just absolutely ENORMOUS... adding a good 3 inches to your head on both sides, and weighing a ton. They were just completely uncomfortable... especially since they clamp down really hard on my glasses. Sound Blaster Jam is like the polar opposite. They weigh almost nothing, the earpieces seem measured for human ears, and although the sound quality isn't quite up to par... it still sounds ridiculously good, especially given the low price. Highly recommended, if you're looking for headphones that aren't gigantic.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Viper 001

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I came here to order another pair. I bought these over two years ago for my teenager who wears them constantly around the house. I borrowed them last night and found them to be perfect for watching movies on my ipad. They did not hurt my sensitive ears at all, even after wearing them for three hours straight. That lead me to look up what I bought, and when and I was pleasantly suprised they have lasted this long.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grame

customer_reviews.title: I love them so much
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, I didn't write a review of my first pair, which I still have. I love them so much, I wanted a pair to keep in my car for when I travel so I can listen to books on tapes while working. I am not sure why anyone would need to spend hundreds on headphones, these are so light and comfortable and the distance and signal are very strong. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: C. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight and good sound
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Exactly what I wanted. Ear buds just will not stay in my ears even with the wire around my ear. So I thought I'd try an over the head style. I didn't want noise cancelling headphones so I can still hear if someone is talking to me or I am on a walk and want to hear cars and such. They are lightweight and have great sound. Very comfortable!!! Probably the easiest Bluetooth pairing I've ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: go bucks

customer_reviews.title: Only 1.5 month and battery is dead.
customer_reviews.text: Only 1.5 month, used about 1.5 hours daily, now it won't charge, tried many times, tried with several different cords. Either battery dead or the charging circuit dead. It's over 30 days so can not just do Amazon return, will have to deal with manufacturer warranty. A hassle. 04/24/2020 Returned the product, get a replacement today. Had to pay for shipping it back, but process is smooth through their web site. I'll raise it to 3 star. The headset sound quality is good, it's light, good for outdoor running. Guess I just hit one of the QA snag. Hope this one hold up better. If it hold well for more than two months, I'll update here.
customer_reviews.author: Ting Yao

customer_reviews.title: Dig these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Easily and quickly connected with my Chromebook (Acer R13) which has had difficulty with other Bluetooth peripherals. Sound quality is good enough ("sound quality" is a relative term in this era of streaming content like Sirius XM and Amazon Music.) The bass booster button makes music sound better. The volume buttons are a nice feature. The phones are light. Comfort is not the best I've had, but acceptable (big head). Travelers' note: These are not noise-cancellation headphones by any stretch. Finally, the price is right. What more can you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mercier

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: These are rugged and hold up, where others I've tried break in a matter of weeks. They are wonderfully light, clamp on nicely to my head while moving about and even exercising. I can't imagine using ear buds or clumsy heavy headsets after using these. After a few years of very regular use, I replaced my origingal one with a new one. The clamping strength to my head weakened and the foam began to wear out. But for such a low price, that was plenty long for lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: brg

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable lightweight headphones
customer_reviews.text: The first headphones I have found that are comfortable enough to wear for hours at a time. Very light weight. Not sweat inducing like over the ear styles. Earbuds either fall out too easily, or become uncomfortable in 30 minutes. Sound quality is good enough for streaming music or movies, but don't expect them to match $300 phones. Have a bass boost button and volume, but no other controls. Paired easily, and so far no problem with sound dropping out as I move around the house and yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Daisy Turtle.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best bluetooth headphones I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: It fits very light on my head. It's comfortable. It doesn't squeeze my head like my old Auratek Headphones did. These sound Blaster Jam Headphones sound good. The USB cord that came with it is thick and strong, I like the red color of the cord. I really love the fact that I can plug these headphones into my PC via USB and use them has a direct connect for sound. It's like if I had a Sound Blaster card in my PC but it's in the headphones. I'm really glad I purchase these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Good phones for comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to augment my collection of blue tooth headphones and I own another earlier Creative model that is more sound isolating. The Sound Blaster Jam has foam rubber ear pads, so ambenient noise will filter in. This can be good or bad depending on your listening envrionment, however they are very light weight, comfortable and have good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kennymac

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use them at work to watch training videos and music without disturbing my office mate. For what they cost, they’re pretty good. Battery life is decent. Sound quality is decent. My only complaint is the foam over the ear piece isn’t very thick. After a while I find the hard plastic causes a pressure point that can be quite uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Dino

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, but won't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones - comfortable and good sound at a good price. I use them at my desk all day to listen to music while working. They're supposed to hold a charge for 12 hours of playback...it seems like i just get about half a day... and if i forget to plug them in at the end of the day, they are dead in the morning, even though they've not been playing music overnight. You can listen to music while they are plugged in, so that's good, but i really wish the charge would hold longer.
customer_reviews.author: THEATRIX

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight headphones do the job.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are lightweight and very comfortable. They paired easily on my Linux machine and sound pretty good for phones in the $30 range. They arrived quickly and I would recommend them for the budget-minded shopper
customer_reviews.author: Brian F.

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a few days, but it has become an extension of my self. I use it all the time and its fantastic! Great bass mode. Good battery life. Awesome microphone. This is the bluetooth headset to have, as it is both lightweight and aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Retro headphones are back
customer_reviews.text: Oh Wow, can't say enough of how good these retro looking Bluetooth headphones are, it has a great bass.The mids and lows are exceptional, good volume, having that bass button making a difference. it's comfortable and light , had it on for hours before I remember i had them on, the only negative thing I can think off is the foam pads, it's a little cheap for my taste, good battery life, pair to devices real fast , Bluetooth signal is good.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice. The battery life seems long. Good quality. Doesn't hurt my ears or give me a headache. I have only one complaint and its also a feature others would consider convenient. The play/pause button is located on the right ear. If I try to lay on my right side in bed I keep bumping the button. This headset is angled so I can't just turn it around so it's on the other ear. Some might find this feature great because the button is super easy to find. No feeling around for a tiny raised button on the rim of the speakers. But it being so accessible means it's also too easy to bump accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Beachley

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've EVER Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had bluetooth headphones that were over six times the price of these things, which broke after a few months of use. However, I've had my Soundblaster Jam for almost three years now. (purchased December 2016) I've had zero issues with them. These are the best budget headphones you are going to find. The battery life is great, they are indestructible, and the bluetooth is reliable and easy to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for watching TV.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not audiophile quality, but very lightweight on-the-ear headphones. It's adequate for bedtime TV viewing when I want a break from my heavy around-the-ears headphones (with much better audio quality). As other reviewers have stated, the headband is on the smaller side, the volume is unexpectedly low, and the foam ear pads can become a bit uncomfortable after a while. It seems to take much longer to charge than any of my other headphones and ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Outta Here

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones for it price.
customer_reviews.text: On the go wireless headphones. Audio quality is good, battery time is good. The only downside is when you happen to connect it to a laptop. You are forced to use the hands-free mode unless you are going up for music only. Hands-free mode lower the quality of audio from 16/32 khz to 8 as I remember. Works 100% for phone. Microphone have it pen noise canceling which is good to use at the street
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is amazing. Sounds quality is what i'd expect from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is amazing. Sounds quality is what i'd expect from a $40-60 pair of bluetooth headphones. Given these were about half that price for me I think they're a bargain. Battery life is phenomenal. I tried many pairs of in-ear and on-ear Bluetooth headphones. Most are very uncomfortable for me or just fall out regularly while at the gym. These stay put very well and are quite comfortable. I've read others say they have fallen asleep while wearing them - i call BS. I have a very narrow head and they still apply generous amounts of pressure. No way i'd forget i was wearing them, but I can go a few hours without major 'headphone fatigue'.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth on ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and the first pair is over two years old. I am just getting a backup set as electronic things that last for three years are probably on their last legs. Love the bluetooth and it works well with my other bluetooth stuff. Will consider a third pair in a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: wchaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Low-cost Wireless Upgrade for Kids
customer_reviews.text: These worked well on the long Christmas road trip. My husband and son both concluded "They don't work", until I read part of the huge instruction sheet. Here is the key: After charging, Click and HOLD the big black button for 4 seconds to turn them on (green light), then click again to get them to synchronize via bluetooth (blinking blue light) and you are ready to rock.
customer_reviews.author: N. King

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing sound quality but good form factor
customer_reviews.text: The form factor is nice and they're very light and easy to carry, but they feel fragile and the sound quality was very disappointing. If sound quality is important to you, I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for about 2 weeks now and absolutely love them. They are light, don't slip off, and the controls at yours fingertips - volume, pause, next track, etc - are wonderful. The battery life seems pretty long too. Sometimes I forget to charge them up and they just keep lasting. Great headphones!
customer_reviews.author: EKantor

customer_reviews.title: Really light and acceptable sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Ultra light and acceptable sound for the price. Getting it to pair with my tablet was a bit of a challege but once it did it once, it repeats consistently. Got it to try out a bluetooth approach and not have to worry about it disappearng into a kid's backback (mine or someone else's).
customer_reviews.author: Omnivor

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again if/ when these break down. also great for gifts.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. I've used them for a couple of years now and they're exactly what I need. I mostly listen to podcasts, audiobooks and music on them but nothing outrageously loud. Also nice for handsfree phone calls and using voice commands while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Ktlynn

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are good for the money. We have gone thru several more expensive brands and these sounds just as good, but there Bluetooth microphone works better, not as good as the Jam Transit, but better than the competitors. My wife wears these while exercising and loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Balentine

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these. Reasonably priced small on-ear Bluetooth headphones are almost impossible to find. This pair of headphones lasted a whole 2 weeks before they became stone dead.
customer_reviews.author: zerofoo

customer_reviews.title: Retro feel with Modern parts
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ridiculous. It looks like the headphones I had for my Sony Walkman growing up. But the sound and everything about them is modern enough not to be a bummer. The best part is they are so light and slender you can wear them out and about without feeling like a goober. They won’t sound as good as the Over Ears cans that are out there but the sound is miles ahead of most earbuds and some on ear headphones I’ve tried alonbthe way. These quickly become came my go to headphones in my go bag.
customer_reviews.author: rat

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted ear phones for Christmas. We both enjoy music so I wanted to get her something decent but affordable. The sound quality is great and she likes them. They are blue tooth so she can watch movies from her phone without getting tangled up in cords from headphones. I will be purchasing a pair for myself soon.
customer_reviews.author: Morena

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband so he could listen to podcasts while helping me in the kitchen. They're not noise cancelling, but they aren't marketed to be and we didn't expect they would be. They sound great, the battery lasts a long time, and they're nicely constructed. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KitchenAid Fan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Earpieces are at an angle, at first I thought it would be uncomfortable but the opposite is true. Can wear all day (I am a small woman). Sound is good but I mainly use for talk podcasts and News. Charge easily lasts 10 hour work day. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice pair of bluetooth headset. I love the sound and the comfort. What sets this pair apart from others is the quality of the mic, I tried JBL e40($70) and Skullcandy Uproar ($40) and couldn't make a decent phone call with any of them. But this Blaster Jam exceeded my expectations in terms of phone call quality. Definitely recommend it for the price (I paid $30 for it).
customer_reviews.author: valy

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good value
customer_reviews.text: These Bluetooth headphones are a fairly good value. The headphones pair efficiently and have decent sound quality. Build quality is okay (cheap plastic) but the headphones are lightweight and comfortable enough. Battery power so far has been excellent. Overall, these appear to be a good value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: djames210

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding, affordable headphones. Lightweight and very comfortable. You forget you have them on, and no more "sweaty" ears. I am a senior and have tried many different ones. These win!!! Use mine for TV and for music. Works well with my tablet too. Pairs easily to any bluetooth device. You can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: mldal

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have a creative blue tooth speaker that i use on my patio and i just love it. It performs really well so when i saw these headphones and read some of the reviews i became interested. I've had them a couple of weeks now and have only charged them in the beginning. (Just about an hour or so a day) They sound great, work great, easy to pair with my phone and the bluetooth TaoTronics transmitter that i use on my computer and stereo while using the treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth would not work
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything to get this to pair to my phone. Tried two different phones. Talked to customer service for advice. Finally returned for refund without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Holman

customer_reviews.title: Uh. Maybe?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what to say about this product. For one, the headphones were smaller than expected - but don't get me wrong, they fit fine. They're just smaller than the picture depicts. The sound quality varies from song to song. On some (most) songs, especially songs with high bass, the music sounds very artificial and distant. The sound doesn't quite reach your ears like I thought it would. Other songs, however, sound alright. Podcasts sound okay. I'm still debating whether to return...
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Newman

customer_reviews.title: This was a nice surprisingly good value buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice surprisingly good value buy. I wanted a pair of lightweight bluetooth headphones to use with my tablet at home and this pair fit the bill perfectly. There are many comments about the dated styling but these didn't worry me. Sound is excellent - better than I expected. They are very comfortable. However, if you are looking for a pair of headphones for high quality audio these won't be what you're looking for. If you're looking for something for casual use in a quiet environment, these will be great. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: COLIN LEE

customer_reviews.title: The best wireless headphones I’ve Ever had!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have been having this pair for 2 years now. The best Bluetooth headphones I’ve ever had! One charge holds for a loooong period of time. Strong connection to my phone or computer (both desktop and laptop). Descent sound quality. Those three beat a lot of other 20~40 bucks Bluetooth headphones’ I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: M. June

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for the Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, even for a giant head like mine. Sound is incredible for the price. I've used Creative products since 2005 so I was excited to see this one--they haven't disappointed me yet! Max volume is very loud to me (too loud--and my ears have been abused over the years by sound equipment), so I'm sure the metal heads will be satisfied. Not sure how hip-hop music sounds, bass boost works well for what I listen to, but not sure if their right for that genre. I'd say give them a try, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it works for me. I am very happy with this purchase. Holds it's charge for a long time. I use it for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for what they are
customer_reviews.text: These feel outdated and seem fragile. The sound quality is not that great and their should be more buttons for on and off and pairing and such. I don't like these that much but they are lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Guess I shouldn't complain too much for the cost, but the headset didn't fit well and stopped working after a couple months. Better to spend a bit more and get something with a bit of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: the sound is great and they are very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: the sound is great and they are very easy to use. like some other reviews stated they are curved inward when placed on your ears which was awkward at first but I just stretched them out a little and now they are very comfortable and lightweight. I have dropped them a few times and they haven't broke so they are built pretty sturdy. only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is bc it would've been nice if they came with a cord in case the battery ever dies other than that u cant go wrong with these headphones, the sound is really good, I seen cnet reviewed them and gave them a good review too.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold P.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. The sound is great and they have a separate bass boost control. My only criticism is the control to pause and turn them off is a bit easy to inadvertently bump.
customer_reviews.author: 1HonestMan

customer_reviews.title: You can have quality sound at an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Wow I’m impressed with these headphones I wasn’t expecting the sound quality they provide Also you forget you’re wearing them They are comfortable and lightweight Will definitely recommend this product to friends Another great Jam product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: gail scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Headphones For A Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphone. They're very light and can usually use them for about a week before I have to recharge it, and I probably use them more than 12 hours in that period. Also, they are not very tight on the head and the pads are very soft so I can wear them for hours at a time comfortably. The sound quality is very goods, the sound crisp and clear. Less bass than my older headphones but still very good and the bass is very smooth sounding and good quality. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap headphones for jogging. I don’t know why some people have high expectations for $40 wireless headphones... they work, that’s good enough.
customer_reviews.author: FromPhilly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pair with other devices
customer_reviews.text: . Easy to pair with other devices. Some reviewers have commented negatively about the fixed angle of the ear pads. I wear a 7 5/8 hat and find that the angle is very comfortable.Lightweight, Excellent Sound. I place my MP3 player in one room and these headphones operate properl;y from one end of my house to the other. I can also walk, as much as 10-12 feet, outside my home and they continue to receive very well. I mention that be cause my outside walls are stucco which has a solid layer of metal mesh! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for watching Netflix on my ipad without annoying anyone. The sound is great, I had no trouble to pair it with my iPad and iPhone. They are very light and you can listen to them for quite a while before having to recharge them.
customer_reviews.author: Approverman

customer_reviews.title: Shhhhh, I’m trying to hear my headphones
customer_reviews.text: There are several things I like about these headphones, including their light weight, long battery life, and easy pairing with all my blue tooth devices. They’re almost perfect on ear headphones to run in (ear buds always fall out of my ears). What will probably make me return them is their pitiful max volume. The overall sound quality is ok...not great, but ok. But I like an immersive sound experience, and these just aren’t loud enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sl85

customer_reviews.title: Great budget headset!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my 11yo son who is typically hard on things, but of the age to appreciate good design and quality. This set has been perfect for him! So far so good at one month of ownership with nearly daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Midwestmom

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and wireless distance
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing! Great sound quality and good wireless range. They are not tight nor loose fitting. The material is super soft and provides long lasting comfort. Battery life is comparable to other wireless headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Peters

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight w good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: NOT sound canceling. Lightweight w good sound quality. Charge lasted for 2 months when it was not used very much. I will use it for meditations and audio books.
customer_reviews.author: Texas mama

customer_reviews.title: Creative makes great products for the price
customer_reviews.text: Creative makes great products for the price. I had the Creative WP-350 for some time before moving to this headset. They are lightweight, and in my opinion good for workouts etc. The battery life is a lot lower than the wp-350 which was upsetting and the buttons are not as user friendly. The power adapter plugs in backwards which is a bit annoying. They fit well, and Im not sure if it's just my head.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Martin

customer_reviews.title: good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The headset itself feels like it's made out of cheap plastic and foam but I ended up really surprised by the sound quality. It has very nice bass output and treble. I have bass boost off because I already like how it sounds with it off. You can download sound blaster software if you use on your PC to further control the output, but I like what I heard out of the box. Battery life is not the best but manageable. Overall a good wireless headset for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Great, Affordable Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an affordable set of headphones for a while. These are GREAT! I'm wearing them as we speak. I use them at my desktop computer but I've found that I can walk to the opposite end of the house and not lose connection to my music. So nice to not have to deal with cords! Recharge is a little slow, but the charge lasts for around 6 hours, which makes up for it. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: BusyMom

customer_reviews.title: Its okay, serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: The range is amazing!! Volume isn't that loud, but its loud enough to be comfortable. The BASS boost is great! being able to skip songs and also speak on a phone call is great! Its a decent buy, the price may not justify the actual product though, but if you need a simple bluetooth earphone this will work
customer_reviews.author: Jason J.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone with surprisingly clear and powerful sound
customer_reviews.text: Great headphone with surprisingly clear and powerful sound. Bought it to watch movies and for work. No sweaty ears and very light. Charge lasts a few days with apprx 3 hours on skype in the morning and the same at night watching stuff. However it does give off a good amount of sound to others since there is not much isolation from the sponges and does not pair with a second device even though it is BT 4.1.
customer_reviews.author: Crusht

customer_reviews.title: Although these are not the best sounding headphones in the world
customer_reviews.text: Although these are not the best sounding headphones in the world, they are cheap, the bluetooth is easy to use, and are very durable. I wear these while I'm working; usually 4-6 hours/day. I like these because you can still hear people talking to you while you're wearing them. I have had these for 9 months and they work just as well as the day I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Anna C

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble with most on-ear headphones hurting my ears, which is why I chose these. The ear pads are like old school foam headphones, which is incredibly comfortable. I use these everyday around the house and haven't had any issues with comfort or sound quality. They charge fast and hold their charge for a few days with how much I use them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I can wear these for hours. Great sound, but you can also hear if someone is talking to you. Battery lasts several hours too (6 or more).
customer_reviews.author: DrB

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great. They are durable, they sound good and the battery life is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: while running and pretty much everything else
customer_reviews.text: The most versatile headphones I have ever owned. I had no idea how much of a difference not having any cord to deal with would make. I wear them while getting ready in the morning, while walking to my car, while driving, while walking to my office, while running and pretty much everything else. I started wearing them when I go to play basketball and I feel like I am in NBA2K. Do yourself a favor and buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this style headphone, but these are oddly shaped and didn't feel right. Sound was ok, but not great. Ended up going with JBL rewind which are a similar style and fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B

customer_reviews.title: Seamless, sleek and stylish. Slightly tight.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! I'm addicted to audiobooks from the library and podcasts. I can leave my phone downstairs and listen upstairs. Or leave phone in the kitchen and move the car out of the garage. Absolutely wonderful! Only complaint is that it can become tight and slightly uncomfortable on my ears after extended use (about an hour), which I refuse to give in, so simply adjust a lot. My head and ears are small by the way, still able to use kid's glasses and hats.
customer_reviews.author: RMJones

customer_reviews.title: Freaking love these
customer_reviews.text: It has a great range. I like to listen to podcasts and audiobooks while cleaning and find I can get quite far away from my phone before any sort of connection issues. They are a great price and great quality. I love the volume buttons, play/pause. The battery life is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: good bluetooth and wireless connection
customer_reviews.text: i have had these headphones close to two years. I have enjoyed them for not only being wireless bit lightweight and sound quality is very good. For an inexpensive wireless bluetooth headphone i have more than been satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These Jam heaphones have multiplied the utility and enjoyment of my Android phone (S5). The build is sturdy; The fit is comfortable and secure; The weight is unnoticeable; The earphone sound quality is excellent. Voice quality through the built in microphone is excellent; Connectivity is seamless; Controls are convenient and intuitive. These phones bear foam ear cushions that pass ambient sounds. Given the portability of these headphones this adds a level of convenience and safety in their wearing as a casual accessory and while on pedestrian forays.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: I got these because I love the 90's look they have
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I love the 90's look they have, and weren't too expensive. They charge fast and setup is easy. Only downfall are that they are on the quiet side, and they arent super comfy
customer_reviews.author: storm

customer_reviews.title: I love these. Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Great for the price. My only problem: first set lasted 4 months. But I use several hours a day. I replaced them with same thing. Hoping they last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: good sound, good price, no frills
customer_reviews.text: Has good sound for its price and is comfortable. It will not pair with my Motorola phone though, so I cannot speak for its call quality. You would not want to use these when sweating or have them get wet, just for indoor use in my opinion. The battery life is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: benji377

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Quality and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfect for audiobooks. The sound is crisp and clear with no feedback. What I like most is they turn on and off easily and are not sharing buttons like my previous set.
customer_reviews.author: unco

customer_reviews.title: Really really good sound from this headphone
customer_reviews.text: Really really good sound from this headphone. There highs and the lows are really there and clear. I was surprised by the sound quality of this headphone. Also for those who want some extra bass there's a dedicated bass boost button. Music playtime on this is outstanding! I can go for days without having to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Fadaboey

customer_reviews.title: They're not the best sounding headphones you can buy
customer_reviews.text: They're not the best sounding headphones you can buy, but they're really cheap, supremely light and comfortable, and the battery life is fantastic. They let a lot of outside noise by, which can be a pro or a con, depending on what you're looking for. I own plenty of nice corded "audiophile" headphones, but for use on the go, I've been choosing these more often than not, lately. Highly recommended (for what they are.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Levin

customer_reviews.title: Great price point
customer_reviews.text: Really good for the price, a little tight on my big head. And would like the ear cups just a little bigger But very light and comfortable. Great for walking
customer_reviews.author: Wayne C. Kiefer

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out and running.
customer_reviews.text: Great for running and going to the gym. I like that these sit on the ear, have foam covers, and don't wrap around the top off the ear like other blutooth head phones. These head phones also don't slip and don't get in the way of wearing sunglasses when I'm out running.
customer_reviews.author: John Willis

customer_reviews.title: These have good quality sound and sink up with droid phones easily
customer_reviews.text: These have good quality sound and sink up with droid phones easily. The controls are of good size and easy to use without hitting the wrong buttons. They work well with watch videos with no lag from the voice to video. The battery life is great and takes a very short time for a full recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Good overall value
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, lightweight and overall great value for a sub-$50 headphone. Although I have a Bose for outdoor commutes, this lightweight headphone from Creative is what I use when I’m on bed or couch listening to music or podcasts. Ability to take phone calls is an advantage. Style is nothing fancy like Beats or Skullcandy but, hey I am in my mid-30s.
customer_reviews.author: bestofbala

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: For weeks my daughter kept complaining of headaches and we finally figured out that it was because these were too tight on her head!! Given she is only 10 yo and weighs 73 lbs, I doubt they would be comfortable on anyone. Threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Katsoulis

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing quality, especially for the price. I should note that they don't fold up like a lot of other headphones, but they are smaller than most over-ear headphones to begin with. I previously had Beats over-ear beats followed by Bose, and these are a wonderful and inexpensive replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

product_meta.title: Creative Sound Blaster Jam Ultra-Light Bluetooth Headset
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingKeep it light and breezy with our new member from the Sound Blaster family. The Sound Blaster JAM is a pair of ultra-light Bluetooth wireless headset that gives you freedom to roam in comfort, no matter how long your playlist is. Untethered and untangled. Freedom can't get any sweeter when you can play, pause or personalize your audio experience with bass enhancement - all within one click! Complete with Bluetooth 4.1 and Near Field Communication (NFC) technology, you can pair and play without much fuss.
feature_bullets: Ergonomic fit with soft ear cushions to ensure comfort and long listening hours. Connectivity Technology: Wireless
Made of exceptionally lightweight materials to minimize bulk and increase mobility
Extended Bluetooth playback - Get up to 12 hours of wireless audio streaming with the Sound Blaster JAM
One-tap bass enhancement - Instantly add punch to your music with a single tap on the ear cup of headset
Convenient charging - Simply charge the Sound Blaster JAM via USB through a PC/Mac
